attributes.action: reform how child maintenance  calculates  payments
attributes.additional_details: at the  moment   before pay is how calculations  are made . but  you pay a ex partner  at  after deductions  which  means you  paying tax on money you dont get and the payments  are higher , and hmrc states any deductions  before tax are non taxable yet due to government  ruling they  its still taxed. it is a  massive  over sight and also re assessment  every year to totally  wrong as if someone has to work harder to get out of debt their  ex benefits even more , how is this fair ... you push the paying parent further into debt
attributes.background: at the moment  child maintenance  calculations  are made from top line  so before  and tax  and  other deductions,  this  needs to change to after tax and deductions . and should  not be  a year on year calculation.
